intro: Luzula nemorosa var. rubella, commonly known as the red-flowered woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces spikes of small, reddish-brown flowers in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its compact size and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
